They are both part of the leavening process, which is a big part of cooking, and people often don’t know the difference between these ingredients.  You can think of leavening as “food that puffs up” or “expands as it cooks”.  To leaven something like a cake or bread, you need an ingredient that can actually expand during the cooking process.  What happens is that the item contains a gas or liquid that can expand inside of the cake or bread dough, like a little balloon, and cause the item to rise.  
For example, if you make cookies, the flour will be able to expand because it contains the gas carbon dioxide.  If you try to cook the flour in its liquid form (by itself) it would get all of the liquid out of the flour, and it would never expand or rise.  To get around this, you can mix the flour and baking soda together, and you can use the combination of the two ingredients to get the gas out of the flour.  Then, the gas from the baking soda can expand and lift the cookie.  Baking soda also has a pH of about 8, which means it makes dough that is rather alkaline, or not very acidic.  This is important, because some acid ingredients, like vinegar or lemon juice, will cause baked goods to brown quicker.

A Minnesota mother of three has been accused of stealing more than 5000 pairs of men’s ski boots from a home. Jennifer Papp, 33, was arrested after police found 307 ski boots at her home and. the house of a 46-year-old woman with three children. Papp, of Crystal. Lake, was charged with two counts of grand theft. She was being held at the Crystal Lake jail in bond of $15,000. The. items include ski boots, jackets and jackets with ski straps that. hang down to the feet. Officers noticed the shoes at the house of the. 46-year-old woman in Crystal Lake, and they had also been missing from the. home of a 13-year-old boy in the city. The victim told police she lost her. ski boots. Police received a tip off about the stolen items from a man who owned ski boots. The. boots were found when Papp visited the house to pick up her daughter. While. visiting her daughter, Papp was questioned by police about the missing. boots, and she was arrested. Police. said they found three men’s ski boots, a ski jacket and a ski. strap, all in good condition. One of the victims, a 32-year-old guy, told. a police investigator over the phone that the boot he was missing was. his favorite. ‘That’s where I’m putting my winter gear and I can’t. lose it,’ he told the investigator. Police are searching for two other men. A. police detective said investigators are trying to get more information out. of the. suspect’s mother, but have not yet finished speaking to her. Papp has. been dating a Crystal Lake police chief for eight months. A. Crystal Lake police detective, who was not authorized to discuss the. case and spoke on condition of anonymity, said he could not say too. much about the police investigation because he was not authorized to talk to the public. According to his personnel file, Papp was a. licensed social worker. She was married once, to a man she described as. her “best friend,” but they divorced. Papp. and chief Bob Strohmeyer have been living together in Crystal Lake for eight. months. Papp is charged with violating her probation over a 2008. DUI charge, which was dismissed after three months. She still has to pay a $500 fine as part of her probation. Strohmeyer, 43, is the police chief for Crystal Lake and a. 1998 graduate of Crystal Lake South High School. He will be sworn in to office on June 15, and he will become the first police chief in the city's history. A. community group plans a public meeting with Strohmeyer to. discuss police-community relations. In a statement, Papp said she was. “very sorry” for her actions and was “extremely remorseful.” She. said she got caught up in a situation over one pair of ski boots, and. she was grateful that no one was hurt. She also. thanked Strohmeyer and her daughter for helping her through “a very. difficult time.” The Minnesota Board of Criminal. Justice recommended that Papp be released on her own recognizance without. bail.

I have made several different suggestions to help you make healthier food choices. If you could follow my suggestions you could improve your diet and probably get healthier. Here are some of my suggestions:

1)  Try to plan your meals and snacks for the whole week on a Monday morning. You can write your meal plan down and put it somewhere you will see it so that you aren’t always in the kitchen on your own. And when you buy groceries and are in the shopping aisle make a list.
2)  Choose fruits and vegetables that are at the bottom of the food pyramid and have an asterisk next to them. These foods are the most nutritious and least processed. If you want something sweet you can choose a candy or a piece of fruit with an asterisk next to it.
3)  Choose foods that are in the middle of the food pyramid. These foods have a circle next to them. These foods are usually better than other foods. Choose less processed foods with a circle next to them.
4)  Choose foods that are at the top of the food pyramid. These foods are the lowest on the food pyramid. These foods are the least nutritious and the most processed. They should have a star next to them.
5)  Eat whole grains- breads, cereals, rice, pasta, etc. Choose whole grain foods if they have a blue strand next to them. Whole grains are good for you.
6)  Eat lean meats. Chicken, turkey, beef, pork, etc.
7)  Drink water instead of sugary drinks. Milk, juice, and soda are not good for you.
8)  Have less than 100-150 calories of added sugar per day. If you would need to drink one cup of milk, you probably shouldn’t have the extra sugar.
9)  Keep track of the amount of calories you are eating per day. You can use a food scale or a measuring cup. You can also use the food scale to make your meal plan and shopping list.
10)  Eat fewer than 50-100 grams of added fat per day for most foods.

I hope you find these suggestions helpful in improving your diet.
